channel.title: Running a String as code (java)
channel.description:
How would I go about making a procedure that could do this
RunAsCode("System.out.print("HEY");"); and it will run that string as code ?
thanks,
grandstinger

item.title: Running a String as code (java)
item.dc:creator: @sparkz2k7 sparkz2k7
item.description:
@sparkz2k7 wrote:

You need to use the java development API. that’s the only thingg i could think of which would allow anything like this to happen. But I can’t see why you’d want to reverse code in the first place.

Read full topic

item.title: Running a String as code (java)
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

My library has support for scripting Java source code. Take a look at the Artifact (the name of it) part of it here: https://github.com/macroing/CEL4J

Edit: All you need to run it is the following:

import javax.script.ScriptEngine;
import javax.script.ScriptEngineManager;
import javax.script.ScriptException;

public final class HelloWorld {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            ScriptEngineManager scriptEngineManager = new ScriptEngineManager();

            ScriptEngine scriptEngine = scriptEngineManager.getEngineByExtension("java");
            scriptEngine.eval("System.out.println(\"Hello, World!\");");
        } catch(ScriptException e) {

        }
    }
}

Read full topic

item.title: Running a String as code (java)
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:11, topic:552930”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=671843.msg4492935#msg4492935 date=1439322821]

Since Java 6, you can compile and run a Java compilation unit defined as a String or a File, however you wouldn’t be able to run an arbitrary snippet like OP would like. This seems like it would be the best option (less hacky if you ask me)

If you wrap it in some context (like a class and public static method), you could.

Right, but nothing arbitrary. Which is what it appears OP wants
[/quote]

Why couldn’t it be arbitrary? Any Java code could be inserted into a method. With a bit of cleverness you could even support defining other methods and classes and handle imports. I think it’s quite possible to execute arbitrary code. In fact, this whole pipeline is used in legitimate software stacks for auto-reloading and auto-recompiling of code during runtime, etc.[/quote]

Because it appears to me that OP would like to run a single line of code (sysout for example) inside an existing method, which cannot be done with the Java compiler API, it must be an entire compilation unit.

Read full topic

item.title: Running a String as code (java)
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:8, topic:552930”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=671843.msg4492906#msg4492906 date=1439312135]

Since Java 6, you can compile and run a Java compilation unit defined as a String or a File, however you wouldn’t be able to run an arbitrary snippet like OP would like. This seems like it would be the best option (less hacky if you ask me)

If you wrap it in some context (like a class and public static method), you could.
[/quote]

Right, but nothing arbitrary. Which is what it appears OP wants[/quote]

Why couldn’t it be arbitrary? Any Java code could be inserted into a method. With a bit of cleverness you could even support defining other methods and classes and handle imports. I think it’s quite possible to execute arbitrary code. In fact, this whole pipeline is used in legitimate software stacks for auto-reloading and auto-recompiling of code during runtime, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Running a String as code (java)
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

You can do this by using the Java compiler API as Chassy mentioned, then a class loader to load the class definition that was compiled, and finally reflection to run the code. It’s actually not terribly difficult to do, but it’s certainly not very efficient. Why do you want to?

Read full topic

item.title: Running a String as code (java)
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

well, you have two options that I can think of

use some reflection hackjob

or use the java scripting api

You could easily use the nashorn engine in the scripting api parse the string and execute the code.

Read full topic

item.title: Running a String as code (java)
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

You would likely need to use an API because the code in the string would still need to be compiled.

Quick search led me to JavaCompiler API or Groovy.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/935175/convert-string-to-code

Read full topic
